name: Pure Hands
mission: Pure Hands, Inc.s mission is preservation of human lives by elimination of hunger through detection, prevention and treatment of malnutrition. Pure Hands, Inc. tackles the underlying causes of malnutrition and poverty during and after emergency situations
theoryOfChange: Pure Hands states its goal is to make an impactful difference by focusing its dedicated team and resources into building a long-term solution for Yemen, and that it improves lives by providing access to basic necessities for survival: food, water, and medicine.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://purehands.org/zakat (Source: https://purehands.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)

components.name: Underserved Space

components.improvement_suggestion: Increase operating reserves to reduce continuity risk; set a board-approved minimum (typically at least 3 months).

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.

score_details.score_summary: Pure Hands Inc. shows exceptional alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://purehands.org/zakat (Source: https://purehands.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Pure Hands holds a Charity Navigator score of 89.75/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 98.2%.
The organization reported total revenue of $184,894,296 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised.
Pure Hands works to deliver quality relief, livelihood, and capacity-building services to vulnerable communities in Yemen.
The organization provides various giving methods for donors to support humanitarian programs.
Pure Hands is Zakat-eligible and follows specific policies regarding asnaf categories for distribution.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Pure Hands earns a solid overall score due to its massive scale of operations in a high-urgency humanitarian zone and its exceptional financial efficiency, though its overall score is tempered by low working capital reserves.
areas_for_improvement: Limited liquidity with only 0.4 months of working capital available
Opportunity to improve impact measurement and reporting to increase directness scores

dimension_explanations.alignment: Pure Hands shows high alignment for Muslim donors with a score of 46/50, driven by its focus on the urgent humanitarian crisis in Yemen and its Zakat-eligible status [5]. The organization provides clear pathways for Zakat distribution in accordance with Islamic principles [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a direct provision model through programs like the Blessed Bakery, Health initiatives, and Food Security projects [3]. While it operates with a high program expense ratio of 98.2%, the impact score of 28/50 reflects a moderate cost per beneficiary of approximately 10.36 and a need for more robust evidence of long-term outcomes [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Pure Hands Inc. delivers critical humanitarian relief and sustainable development services to vulnerable communities in Yemen through high-efficiency programming.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 98.2%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need
High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.02 per $1 raised
Verified Zakat-eligible status with clear policies on asnaf categories
baseline_narrative.summary: Pure Hands Inc. is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing quality relief, livelihood, and capacity-building services to communities in Yemen and beyond [3]. The organization maintains a strong financial standing with a total revenue of $184,894,296 and holds a Charity Navigator score of 89.75/100 [1][2].

case_against.summary: The primary concern is financial sustainability; the charity has <cite id="14">less than one month of operating reserves</cite>.

alignment.explanation: Pure Hands is highly aligned for Muslim donors, featuring <cite id="18">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and serving <cite id="19">fuqara and masakin</cite> in Yemen.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Pure Hands due to its <cite id="9">Candid Platinum Seal</cite> and <cite id="10">fully independent board of directors</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should <cite id="16">formalize and publish more detailed board governance policies</cite> to address current 'weak' governance indicators in some assessments.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="5">100.0% program ratio</cite> and a low <cite id="17">cost of $10.36 per beneficiary</cite>.
impact.improvement: The charity must <cite id="14">increase operating reserves</cite> from the current 0.4 months to at least 3 months to ensure long-term stability.

rich_narrative.headline: Pure Hands Inc. delivers critical humanitarian relief and sustainable development services to vulnerable communities in Yemen through high-efficiency programming.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to provide emergency humanitarian relief specifically to Yemen through a highly efficient, zakat-eligible organization with minimal overhead.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure nearly 100% of their donation reaches the field
Prioritize the humanitarian crisis in Yemen over other regions
Seek to fulfill zakat obligations through verified asnaf categories
Value high-growth organizations with a Platinum transparency rating
giving_considerations: The organization has very low cash reserves, meaning it relies on constant new donations
Focus is geographically restricted to Yemen
Direct provision model means the charity handles implementation directly
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking long-term endowment-style stability or those looking for diversified international impact beyond Yemen.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The charity tracks <cite id="15">two outcome metrics</cite> and has a clear strategy, but lacks independent third-party evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Pure Hands uses a <cite id="20">clear theory of change</cite> focused on delivering primary medical care and relief through sustainable programs.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the $10.36 spent per beneficiary actually results in improved health and nutrition outcomes.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The ongoing crisis in Yemen and the charity's <cite id="4">24.3% growth rate</cite> indicate significant capacity to absorb more capital.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Pure Hands maintains a <cite id="5">98.2% program expense ratio</cite>, which is exceptionally high even for the humanitarian sector.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Larger institutional history and diverse program sectors

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="5">100.0% of its expenses toward programs</cite> and maintains a remarkably low fundraising cost of <cite id="6">$0.02 per $1 raised</cite>.
Pure Hands has demonstrated robust organizational growth with a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 24.3%</cite>, reaching <cite id="3">$184.9 million in annual revenue</cite>.
The charity holds a <cite id="9">Candid Platinum Seal</cite> and a <cite id="8">Charity Navigator score of 89.75/100</cite>, supported by <cite id="10">100% independent board members</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Pure Hands exhibits a rare level of fiscal leanest, reporting a <cite id="5">98.2% program expense ratio</cite> in its most recent financial cycle. This is supported by a <cite id="11">fundraising efficiency of $0.01 to $0.02 per $1 raised</cite>, which is significantly better than industry benchmarks. Their operational model focuses on <cite id="7">direct provision in Yemen</cite>, covering essential needs from <cite id="12">food security to child protection</cite>. Furthermore, the organization's governance is robust, featuring a <cite id="10">100% independent board</cite> and a <cite id="13">perfect 100 score in the Culture & Community beacon</cite> from Charity Navigator.
rich_narrative.summary: Pure Hands Inc. is a specialized humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating the humanitarian crisis in Yemen through <cite id="1">quality relief, livelihood, and capacity-building services</cite>. Founded in <cite id="2">2012</cite>, the organization has rapidly scaled its operations to address one of the world's most acute humanitarian emergencies. In 2023, Pure Hands reported a <cite id="3">total revenue of $184,894,296</cite>, reflecting a significant <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 24.3%</cite>. The organization is distinguished by its extreme financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 98.2%</cite> according to recent filings, ensuring that donor contributions are directed almost entirely to frontline services. This efficiency is further evidenced by its fundraising performance, spending only <cite id="6">$0.02 to raise every $1</cite>. Pure Hands operates across multiple critical sectors, including <cite id="7">food security, health, WASH (Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene), and shelter</cite>, primarily utilizing a direct provision delivery model to reach vulnerable populations. The organization holds a <cite id="8">Charity Navigator score of 89.75/100</cite> and has achieved the <cite id="9">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>, indicating a high level of public accountability and data sharing.
